snippet: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, facing criticism of his counterinsurgency strategy, compared reporting to a “fourth generation of warfare, and even fifth.”
abstract: Egyptian government under Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi likens negative news reporting on its handling of militant attacks to another form of warfare; cabinet includes provision in anti-terrorism bill that threatens two-year prison terms for journalists who contradict official death tolls.
lead_paragraph: President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, facing criticism of his counterinsurgency strategy, compared reporting to a “fourth generation of warfare, and even fifth.”

headline.main: Egypt Warns Journalists Over Coverage of Militant Attacks
headline.print_headline: After Militant Attacks, Egypt Perceives New Threat: Media

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
